thread.title: Boulder activists plan march to coincide with GOP debate
thread.title_full: Boulder activists plan march to coincide with GOP debate

title: Boulder activists plan march to coincide with GOP debate
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Boulder activists plan march to coincide with GOP debate Activists in Boulder are hoping to draw 10,000 people for a march on the same day as the Republican presidential debate at the University of Colorado. Post to Facebook Boulder activists plan march to coincide with GOP debate Activists in Boulder are hoping to draw 10,000 people for a march on the same day as the Republican presidential debate at the University of Colorado.  //on9news.tv/1Ryba8E   Join the Conversation To   Boulder activists plan march to coincide with GOP debate Associated Press, news source 10:51 a.m. MDT October 9, 2015 Boulder's Central Park CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
BOULDER, Colo. (AP) - Activists in Boulder are hoping to draw 10,000 people for a march on the same day as the Republican presidential debate at the University of Colorado. 
The Daily Camera reports that organizers are calling the Oct. 28 demonstration a march for civic engagement. It will begin at the Glen Huntington Bandshell in Boulder's Central Park and ends at the Coors Events Center, where the debate will be underway. 
One of the march's organizers Gary Roland says groups that are interested in climate change, health care, gender equality and education are likely to participate. Interested groups have been asked to create a piece of art to demonstrate their vision for the future, which will be displayed across from the event center.
